title: Insert Before
hint: Use i to enter insert mode, type text, then Esc
solutionExplanation: i — enters Insert mode before the cursor. Type 'hello ' to insert the text. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Append After
hint: Use a to append after cursor
solutionExplanation: a — enters Insert mode after the cursor. Type ' world' to append the text. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Open Line Below
hint: Use o to open a new line below
solutionExplanation: o — opens a new line below and enters Insert mode. Type 'line2'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Delete Character
hint: Use x to delete character under cursor
solutionExplanation: x — deletes the character under the cursor, removing the extra 'l'.

title: Delete Line
hint: Use dd to delete the entire line
solutionExplanation: dd — deletes the entire current line.

title: Delete to End of Line
hint: Use D to delete from cursor to end of line
solutionExplanation: D — deletes from the cursor to the end of the line, removing '// comment'.

title: Delete Word
hint: Use dw to delete a word
solutionExplanation: dw — 'delete word': the d operator combined with the w motion deletes from cursor to the start of the next word.

title: Delete to End
hint: Use d$ to delete from cursor to end of line
solutionExplanation: d$ — deletes from the cursor to the end of the line. The d operator with $ motion.

title: Delete to Start
hint: Use d0 to delete from cursor to start of line
solutionExplanation: d0 — deletes from the cursor to the start of the line. The d operator with 0 motion.

title: Change Word
hint: Use cw to change the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: cw — 'change word': deletes the word under the cursor and enters Insert mode. Type 'goodbye'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Change Line
hint: Use cc to change the entire line
solutionExplanation: cc — 'change line': clears the entire line and enters Insert mode. Type 'new content'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Change to End
hint: Use C to change from cursor to end of line
solutionExplanation: C — 'change to end': deletes from cursor to end of line and enters Insert mode. Type 'new_ending'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Duplicate Line
hint: Use yyp to duplicate the current line
solutionExplanation: yy — yanks (copies) the current line. p — pastes it below.

title: Move Line Down
hint: Use ddp to move a line down
solutionExplanation: dd — deletes the current line ('second'). p — pastes it below the current line, effectively moving it down.

title: Paste Before
hint: Use dwbP to rearrange words
solutionExplanation: dw — deletes the word 'hello'. b — moves back to 'world'. P — pastes 'hello' before the cursor, giving 'hello world'.

title: Open Line Above
hint: Use O to open a new line above
solutionExplanation: O — opens a new line above the cursor and enters Insert mode. Type 'new'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Insert Comma
hint: Use i to insert before the space
solutionExplanation: i — enters Insert mode before the cursor (at the space). Type ','. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Remove Extra
hint: Use x to delete the extra character
solutionExplanation: x — deletes the character under the cursor, removing the extra 'o'.

title: Drop Line
hint: Use dd to delete the line
solutionExplanation: dd — deletes the entire current line ('remove').

title: Delete Tail
hint: Use d$ to delete from cursor to end of line
solutionExplanation: d$ — deletes from cursor position to the end of the line, removing ' this line'. Cursor is on the space.

title: Delete Prefix
hint: Use d0 to delete from cursor to start of line
solutionExplanation: d0 — deletes from cursor position to the start of the line, removing 'remove '.

title: Change Word
hint: Use cw to change the word under cursor
solutionExplanation: cw — 'change word': deletes 'old' and enters Insert mode. Type 'new'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Change To End
hint: Use C to change to end of line
solutionExplanation: C — changes from cursor to end of line. Deletes 'foo' and enters Insert mode. Type 'bar'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Duplicate Line
hint: Use yyp to duplicate the line
solutionExplanation: yy — yanks the current line ('one'). p — pastes it below, creating a duplicate.

title: Yank Word
hint: Use yw then p to paste the word
solutionExplanation: yw — yanks the word 'foo '. p — pastes it after the cursor, inserting 'foo ' between 'foo' and 'bar'.

title: Quick Substitute
hint: Use s to delete the character under cursor and enter insert mode in one step
solutionExplanation: s — deletes the character under cursor ('=') and enters Insert mode. Type '=>'. <Esc> — returns to Normal mode.

title: Delete Three Lines

before.text:
keep
remove1
remove2
remove3
keep too

hint: Use a count before dd to delete multiple lines, e.g. 3dd
solutionExplanation: 3dd — deletes 3 lines starting from the current line using a count prefix.

title: Multi-Word Delete
hint: Use d with a count and motion, e.g. d3w to delete three words
solutionExplanation: d3w — the d operator with count 3 and w motion deletes three words from cursor.
